p: ZIKV has drawn global public health attention due to its alleged linkage with the increasing incidence of microcephaly. In September 2015, increased frequency of microcephalic babies was documented in females residing in ZIKV endemic regions of Brazil, thus, raising the question of a probable association. Thereafter, a total of 2366 confirmed cases of microcephaly associated with ZIKV infection have been noted in Brazil.[ 68]
